metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7445 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
convert.c in OpenJPEG before 2.1.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via vectors involving the variable s.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7445` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> it seems like the official patch for this issue is the one in commit f053508f6, however, in openjpeg xenial seems to not be vulnerable because another patch has been applied to it, the one available at https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/files/ 478630/openjpeg-nullptr-github-issue-842.ppm-dif.txt.

criterions.comment: openjpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1').
